us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.tools

Class EuclidFrameAPITestTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.referenceFrame.tools.EuclidFrameAPITestTools

  • public class EuclidFrameAPITestTools
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides tools that using reflection can perform a variety of comparison-based assertions on a frame geometry given its corresponding frameless type.

    These tools are still experimental and are improved through heavy internal usage for building Euclid's test suite. The objective it to make this class usable for third party classes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  EuclidFrameAPITestTools.FrameTypeBuilder<T extends ReferenceFrameHolder>
      Implement this interface to create builders for frame types such as FrameQuaternion.
      static interface  EuclidFrameAPITestTools.GenericTypeBuilder
      Implement this interface to create builders for any type.
      static interface  EuclidFrameAPITestTools.RandomFrameTypeBuilder<T>
      Implement this interface to create builders for frame types such as FramePoint2D.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • assertOverloadingWithFrameObjects

        public static void assertOverloadingWithFrameObjects(java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFrameMethods,
                                                     java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFramelessMethods,
                                                     boolean assertAllCombinations)
        Asserts, using reflection, that all methods with frameless arguments, such as Tuple3DReadOnly, are overloaded with their frame type equivalent, i.e. Tuple2DBasics is to be overloaded with FrameTuple2D.
        Parameters:
        typeWithFrameMethods - refers to the type to be tested. This asserts that typeWithFrameMethods properly has all the methods necessary to properly overload typeWithFramelessMethods.
        typeWithFramelessMethods - refers to the type declaring methods with frameless objects that are to be overloaded.
        assertAllCombinations - when false, this asserts that for each method in typeWithFramelessMethods there is one overloading method in typeWithFrameMethods with all the arguments using the equivalent frame type. When true, this asserts that for each method in typeWithFramelessArguments, typeWithFrameMethods overloads it with all the possible combinations of frame & frameless arguments, except for the original frameless signature.

      • assertOverloadingWithFrameObjects

        public static void assertOverloadingWithFrameObjects(java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFrameMethods,
                                                     java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFramelessMethods,
                                                     boolean assertAllCombinations,
                                                     int minNumberOfFramelessArguments)
        Asserts, using reflection, that all methods with frameless arguments, such as Tuple3DReadOnly, are overloaded with their frame type equivalent, i.e. Tuple2DBasics is to be overloaded with FrameTuple2D.
        Parameters:
        typeWithFrameMethods - refers to the type to be tested. This asserts that typeWithFrameMethods properly has all the methods necessary to properly overload typeWithFramelessMethods.
        typeWithFramelessMethods - refers to the type declaring methods with frameless objects that are to be overloaded.
        assertAllCombinations - when false, this asserts that for each method in typeWithFramelessMethods there is one overloading method in typeWithFrameMethods with all the arguments using the equivalent frame type. When true, this asserts that for each method in typeWithFramelessArguments, typeWithFrameMethods overloads it with all the possible combinations of frame & frameless arguments, except for the original frameless signature.
        minNumberOfFramelessArguments - threshold used to filter out methods to assert in typeWithFramelessMethods.

      • assertOverloadingWithFrameObjects

        public static void assertOverloadingWithFrameObjects(java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFrameMethods,
                                                     java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFramelessMethods,
                                                     boolean assertAllCombinations,
                                                     int minNumberOfFramelessArguments,
                                                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Class<?>[]> framelessMethodsToIgnore)
        Asserts, using reflection, that all methods with frameless arguments, such as Tuple3DReadOnly, are overloaded with their frame type equivalent, i.e. Tuple2DBasics is to be overloaded with FrameTuple2D.
        Parameters:
        typeWithFrameMethods - refers to the type to be tested. This asserts that typeWithFrameMethods properly has all the methods necessary to properly overload typeWithFramelessMethods.
        typeWithFramelessMethods - refers to the type declaring methods with frameless objects that are to be overloaded.
        assertAllCombinations - when false, this asserts that for each method in typeWithFramelessMethods there is one overloading method in typeWithFrameMethods with all the arguments using the equivalent frame type. When true, this asserts that for each method in typeWithFramelessArguments, typeWithFrameMethods overloads it with all the possible combinations of frame & frameless arguments, except for the original frameless signature.
        minNumberOfFramelessArguments - threshold used to filter out methods to assert in typeWithFramelessMethods.
        framelessMethodsToIgnore - map containing the name and argument types of the methods in typeWithFramelessMethods to be ignored in this test.

      • assertOverloadingWithFrameObjects

        public static void assertOverloadingWithFrameObjects(java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFrameMethods,
                                                     java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFramelessMethods,
                                                     boolean assertAllCombinations,
                                                     int minNumberOfFramelessArguments,
                                                     java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.reflect.Method> framelessMethodFilter)
        Asserts, using reflection, that all methods with frameless arguments, such as Tuple3DReadOnly, are overloaded with their frame type equivalent, i.e. Tuple2DBasics is to be overloaded with FrameTuple2D.
        Parameters:
        typeWithFrameMethods - refers to the type to be tested. This asserts that typeWithFrameMethods properly has all the methods necessary to properly overload typeWithFramelessMethods.
        typeWithFramelessMethods - refers to the type declaring methods with frameless objects that are to be overloaded.
        assertAllCombinations - when false, this asserts that for each method in typeWithFramelessMethods there is one overloading method in typeWithFrameMethods with all the arguments using the equivalent frame type. When true, this asserts that for each method in typeWithFramelessArguments, typeWithFrameMethods overloads it with all the possible combinations of frame & frameless arguments, except for the original frameless signature.
        minNumberOfFramelessArguments - threshold used to filter out methods to assert in typeWithFramelessMethods.
        framelessMethodFilter - custom filter used on the methods of typeWithFramelessMethods. The assertions are performed on the methods for which framelessMethodFilter.test(method) returns true.

      • assertStaticMethodsCheckReferenceFrame

        public static void assertStaticMethodsCheckReferenceFrame(java.lang.Class<?> typeDeclaringStaticMethodsToTest)
                                                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Asserts, using reflection, that the methods, that are public and static, in typeHoldingStaticMethodsToTest are properly checking and/or setting reference frames of their arguments.

        This assertion expects methods to be declaring arguments as read-only to inform that they are used as input only, and as mutable to inform that they are the output(s).

        Note that this does not perform any assertion for methods with only 1 frame argument.

        This expects methods to throw a ReferenceFrameMismatchException to indicate that the operation cannot be performed because at least two arguments are expressed in a different reference frame.

        Parameters:
        typeDeclaringStaticMethodsToTest - the type in which the methods are to be tested.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if an unexpected throwable has been thrown by a method at invocation time.

      • assertStaticMethodsCheckReferenceFrame

        public static void assertStaticMethodsCheckReferenceFrame(java.lang.Class<?> typeDeclaringStaticMethodsToTest,
                                                          java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.reflect.Method> methodFilter)
                                                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Asserts, using reflection, that the methods, that are public and static, in typeHoldingStaticMethodsToTest are properly checking and/or setting reference frames of their arguments.

        This assertion expects methods to be declaring arguments as read-only to inform that they are used as input only, and as mutable to inform that they are the output(s).

        Note that this does not perform any assertion for methods with only 1 frame argument.

        This expects methods to throw a ReferenceFrameMismatchException to indicate that the operation cannot be performed because at least two arguments are expressed in a different reference frame.

        Parameters:
        typeDeclaringStaticMethodsToTest - the type in which the methods are to be tested.
        methodFilter - custom filter used on the methods. The assertions are performed on the methods for which methodFilter.test(method) returns true.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if an unexpected throwable has been thrown by a method at invocation time.

      • assertMethodsOfReferenceFrameHolderCheckReferenceFrame

        public static void assertMethodsOfReferenceFrameHolderCheckReferenceFrame(EuclidFrameAPITestTools.RandomFrameTypeBuilder<? extends ReferenceFrameHolder> frameTypeBuilder,
                                                                          java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.reflect.Method> methodFilter)
                                                                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Asserts, using reflection, that the methods, that are public and non-static, in the created instance from frameTypeBuilder are properly checking and/or setting reference frames of their arguments.

        This assertion expects methods to be declaring arguments as read-only to inform that they are used as input only, and as mutable to inform that they are the output(s).

        This expects methods to throw a ReferenceFrameMismatchException to indicate that the operation cannot be performed because at least one argument with an immutable frame is expressed in a different reference frame.

        Parameters:
        frameTypeBuilder - builder used to generate an instance of the type to be tested.
        methodFilter - custom filter used on the methods. The assertions are performed on the methods for which methodFilter.test(method) returns true.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if an unexpected throwable has been thrown by a method at invocation time.

      • assertStaticMethodsPreserveFunctionality

        public static void assertStaticMethodsPreserveFunctionality(java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFrameMethodsToTest,
                                                            java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFramelessMethods)
        Assuming the type typeWithFrameMethodsToTest declares the same static methods as declared in typeWithFramlessMethods with the difference of dealing with reference frame holders, this method asserts that the methods in typeWithFrameMethodsToTest does not change the underlying algorithms.

        For each method declared in typeWithFrameMethodsToTest, this methods searched for the equivalent method in typeWithFramelessMethods and the methods from both classes are invoked to compare the output.

        Parameters:
        typeWithFrameMethodsToTest - the type in which the methods are to be tested.
        typeWithFramelessMethods - the type declaring the methods against which the methods from typeWithFrameMethodsToTest are to be compared.

      • assertStaticMethodsPreserveFunctionality

        public static void assertStaticMethodsPreserveFunctionality(java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFrameMethodsToTest,
                                                            java.lang.Class<?> typeWithFramelessMethods,
                                                            java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.reflect.Method> methodFilter)
        Assuming the type typeWithFrameMethodsToTest declares the same static methods as declared in typeWithFramlessMethods with the difference of dealing with reference frame holders, this method asserts that the methods in typeWithFrameMethodsToTest does not change the underlying algorithms.

        For each method declared in typeWithFrameMethodsToTest, this methods searched for the equivalent method in typeWithFramelessMethods and the methods from both classes are invoked to compare the output.

        Parameters:
        typeWithFrameMethodsToTest - the type in which the methods are to be tested.
        typeWithFramelessMethods - the type declaring the methods against which the methods from typeWithFrameMethodsToTest are to be compared.
        methodFilter - custom filter used on the methods. The assertions are performed on the methods for which methodFilter.test(method) returns true.

      • assertFrameMethodsOfFrameHolderPreserveFunctionality

        public static void assertFrameMethodsOfFrameHolderPreserveFunctionality(EuclidFrameAPITestTools.FrameTypeBuilder<? extends ReferenceFrameHolder> frameTypeBuilder,
                                                                        EuclidFrameAPITestTools.GenericTypeBuilder framelessTypeBuilber,
                                                                        java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.reflect.Method> methodFilter)
        Assuming the type built by the frameTypeBuilder declares the same methods as declared in the type built by framelessTypeBuilder with the difference of handling the reference frame information, this method asserts that the methods the type built by the frameTypeBuilder does not change the underlying algorithms.

        For each method declared in the type built by the frameTypeBuilder, this methods searched for the equivalent method in type built by the framelessTypeBuilder and the methods from both classes are invoked to compare the output.

        Parameters:
        frameTypeBuilder - the builder for creating instances of the frame object to test.
        framelessTypeBuilber - the builder for creating instances of the corresponding frameless objects.
        methodFilter - custom filter used on the methods. The assertions are performed on the methods for which methodFilter.test(method) returns true.
